By right should get. But usually spin off  will bump up LHN share price. Once get the subsidiary shares  sell as fast as possible. Because spin off is to leverage on the number of headcounts the parent has to push out subsidiary. Usually the subsi that is doing so so will do that. If the controlling shareholder of the parent holds high percentage  then is a very convenient way to transfer the subsidiary to the controlling shareholder. Controlling shareholder of parent will equal to the controlling shareholder of subsidiary post listing.
